title: Chris Patterson (co-driver)
text:
Chris Patterson (born 6 September 1968) is an Irish professional <a href="rally%20racing">rally racing</a> co-driver.
Career.
Patterson competed first time in the <a href="World%20Rally%20Championship">World Rally Championship</a> (WRC) in 1993 and has won the 2006 <a href="Production%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Production World Rally Championship</a> with <a href="Nasser%20Al-Attiyah">Nasser Al-Attiyah</a>. Patterson is recognised as one of the world's most experienced rally navigators. 29 June 2010 he joined <a href="Petter%20Solberg%20World%20Rally%20Team">Petter Solberg World Rally Team</a> to replace Solberg's retired co-driver <a href="Phil%20Mills">Phil Mills</a>.
After Solberg switched to rallycross in 2013, Patterson was co-driving fellow Irishman <a href="Kris%20Meeke">Kris Meeke</a> on a <a href="Citro%C3%ABn%20DS3%20WRC">Citroën DS3 WRC</a> in <a href="2013%20Rally%20Finland">Rally Finland</a>. They were running in fifth place on Meeke's WRC return before rolling in the final section of the penultimate stage of the rally. They also teamed up for <a href="2013%20Rally%20Australia">Rally Australia</a>, but again retired. In 2014, Patterson became <a href="Khalid%20Al%20Qassimi">Khalid Al Qassimi</a>'s co-driver.
Patterson is set to return to the championship with <a href="Gus%20Greensmith">Gus Greensmith</a>, driving for <a href="M-Sport%20World%20Rally%20Team">M-Sport Ford</a>. This time under the Irish tricolour.
